name: BookBuddi eBook

content: BookBuddi is a "talking eReader" that can both display an eBook's contents and read the book's text aloud to a listener. This allows BookBuddi users to either read or listen to an eBook's contents, depending on their preference.

Each BookBuddi eBook is saved as a BKK file. This file contains binary data that BookBuddi uses to display a book's text and pictures, as well as read the book's contents aloud. Most BKK files contain a children's story, such as Alice in Wonderland, The Princess and the Pea, or The Little Mermaid.

description: A BKK file is an eBook created for use with BookBuddi, an eReader and audiobook program. It contains a book's text and images. Using Microsoft Text to Speech Agent, BookBuddi can read the text a BKK file contains and convert it to audio, allowing readers to use BKK files as both eBooks and audiobooks.

instructions: You can open a BKK file with BookBuddi (Windows). To do so, click the Folder icon in the program's upper-left corner. Then, navigate to and open your BKK file. To play the eBook your BKK file contains as an audiobook, click BookBuddi's Play button.
